snippet: Arafan Koita, an immigrant from Guinea, had to give up his cabdriving job after a beating by a passenger left him legally blind.
abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York, one of the seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, draws $300 for public school uniforms for children of former taxi driver K Arafan Koita, who has recurring vision problems after suffering attack by passenger.
lead_paragraph: Arafan Koita, an immigrant from Guinea, had to give up his cabdriving job after a beating by a passenger left him legally blind.
